trans-unit.source: Represents the primary key field or fields of a record in a data-bound control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> class using the specified dictionary of key field values.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains the key field values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names.

The field values contained in the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `keyTable` parameter are used to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This constructor also allows you to specify a list of the key field names for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object in advance through the `keyNames` parameter.
Because the field names are specified in advance, only the key field values are stored in view state when this constructor is used.
The key field values.
An array of strings that contain the names of the key fields.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> array is equal to the current data key.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
object.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> array is equal to the current data key.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.
The IsTrackingViewState property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object is tracking its view-state changes.
> [!NOTE] > This property is used primarily by control developers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the value of the key field at the specified index from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The zero-based index at which to retrieve the key field value.
The value of the key field at the specified index.
Gets the value of the key field with the specified field name from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The name of the key field for which to retrieve the key field value.
The value of the key field with the specified field name.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The LoadViewState method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
An object that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
state is not and cannot be resolved to a valid .
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The SaveViewState method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class to save the state of the object.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used primarily by control developers.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.
The IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object is tracking its view-state changes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The IStateManager.LoadViewState method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The IStateManager.SaveViewState method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class to save the state of the object.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object as part of the object's view state.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object as part of the object's view state.
Gets the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to retrieve a key field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object, you can use the Value property as a shortcut to determine the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This property is commonly used to determine the key field value of a record when the record has only one key field.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object does not contain any key fields, `null` is returned.
The value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> object that contains every key field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Use the Values property to retrieve an <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object that contains every key field in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
The <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object is often used to iterate through the key fields of a record.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains every key field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
